content: अध्यास् {c2c} <ab>A.</ab> {@--1@} ({%a%}) To lie down, settle upon; occupy, dwell in (as a seat or habitation); seat oneself in or upon, enter upon, get into (as a path &c.) (with <ab>acc.</ab> of place); त्वरिततरमध्यास्यतामियं वनस्थली <ls>K. 28</ls>; <ls n="K.">36</ls>, <ls n="K.">40</ls>; पर्णशालामध्यास्य <ls>R. 1. 95</ls>; द्वितीयमाश्रममध्यासितुं समयः <ls>V. 5</ls>; द्वारदेशमध्यास्ते <ls>Dk. 3</ls> is waiting at the door; <ls>R. 2. 17</ls>; <ls n="R.">4. 74</ls>; <ls n="R.">6. 10</ls>; <ls n="R.">12. 85</ls>; <ls n="R.">13. 22</ls>, <ls n="R. 13.">76</ls>; <ls n="R.">15. 93</ls>; <ls>Me. 76</ls>; <ls>Bk. 1. 5</ls>; <ls>Ms. 7. 77</ls>; अये सिंहासनमध्यास्ते वृषलः <ls>Mu. 3</ls>; भगवत्या प्राश्निकपदमध्यासितव्यं <ls>M. 1</ls> occupy the seat of judge, accept the office of judge. ({%b%}) To take possession of, grasp, seize; धेन्वा तदध्यासितकातराक्ष्या <ls>R. 2. 52</ls> with eyes tremulous on account of her being seized by him (अध्यासितं = आक्रमणं). ({%c%}) To resort to, inhabit; यदध्यासितमर्हद्भिस्तद्धि तीर्थं प्रचक्षते <ls>Ku. 6. 56.</ls> {@--2@} To live in conjugal relation; cohabit with. {@--3@} To be directed or fixed upon. {@--4@} To rule, govern, influence; affect, concern (mostly <ab>Ved.</ab>). {%--<ab>Caus.</ab>%} To cause one to sit down upon; भवंतमध्यासयन्नासनं <ls>Bk. 2. 46.</ls>
